meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 100 kilograms.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sold a quintal of potatoes at the market.
meanings.sent2: The ship carried several quintals of cargo across the ocean.
meanings.sent3: It took a quintal of effort to lift the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him weighed a quintal on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The quintal of books on the shelf threatened to topple over.

meanings.sent1: She had a quintal of patience when dealing with children.
meanings.sent2: The factory produced quintals of paper every day.
meanings.sent3: He had a quintal of excuses for being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The laughter in the room was a quintal of joy.
meanings.sent5: The quintal of stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
